Torsion-resistant, flush headrail 43/42 mm above the door
Made of aluminum (20 mm in diameter, length 145 mm) with a maintenance-free stainless-steel axis

L-shaped door handle and turning lock

Double-latch lock with metal latch and metal whisper trap for silently closing door

the exterior and interior decor of the cubicle

Wide LED indicator above the door
Wide LED occupancy indicator above the doors

The special KEMlight option with LED occupancy indicator is an absolute visual highlight in the design of the washroom and offers the user the possibility of being able to distinguish between a free and occupied cubicle at a glance.

You can conveniently control the LED display through an app, enabling easy and personalized adjustments. This includes intuitive energy-saving settings, like synchronizing lighting with the building’s opening hours, making management straightforward.
The inside indicator “Feel-Safe” shows the user the locking status in the cubicle.

KEMMLIT proudly holds the position of the European market leader in washroom partition systems. Our dedicated teams specialize in designing and manufacturing integrated solutions that seamlessly merge cutting-edge production technologies with premium materials and stringent quality control measures. The result is a range of systems that epitomize excellence, all meticulously crafted in Germany to meet the most exacting standards.

At KEMMLIT, our name embodies the hallmark of quality synonymous with ‘Made in Germany’. As the European market leader in washroom partition wall systems, we provide our customers with comprehensive solutions for bespoke interior washroom needs. From initial consultation to shop-drawing planning and utilizing state-of-the-art manufacturing techniques, our team of specialists ensures a seamless and holistic experience for our valued clients.

For decades, we have been delivering exceptional bespoke partition system solutions for public restroom areas, garnering numerous awards and accolades in recent years. With our extensive selection, every customer can discover the perfect system tailored to their project requirements and budget constraints.
From development and production to installation, along with comprehensive support services before, during, and after project completion, our commitment to prioritizing the client remains unwavering.
Our innovative and adaptable product range meets the most rigorous functional requirements.
Uncertain about the optimal solution for your needs? Interested in learning more about our services?
We’re here to assist you and furnish you with all the necessary information.

KEMMLIT est le leader européen du marché des systèmes de cloisons sanitaires. Nos équipes conçoivent et produisent des solutions intégrées combinant les dernières technologies de production avec des matériaux de haute qualité et un contrôle avancé de la qualité, afin de fournir des systèmes qui satisfont aux exigences les plus strictes – made in Germany.

KEMMLIT est synonyme de haute qualité « made in Germany » et le leader européen du marché des systèmes de cloisons sanitaires. Grâce à notre expertise, nous proposons à nos clients un accompagnement ainsi que des solutions individualisées pour leurs projets d’espaces sanitaires : aide à la planification, dessins techniques, production sur mesure.

Depuis maintenant plusieurs décennies, nous proposons à nos clients des systèmes de cloisons sanitaires haut de gamme sur mesure pour les établissements recevant du public (ERP) qui ont reçu de nombreux prix et récompenses au cours des dernières années. Notre offre complète permet ainsi à chacun de nos clients de trouver le système parfaitement adapté à son projet et son budget.
Durant toute la durée de votre projet, nous n’avons qu’une seule priorité: votre satisfaction !
Notre gamme de produits innovants et adaptables satisfait aux exigences les plus strictes.

Right to know what personal information is being collected about you
A consumer shall have the right to request that a business that collects personal information about the consumer disclose to the consumer the following:
The categories of personal information it has collected about that consumer.
The categories of sources from which the personal information is collected.
The business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling personal information.
The categories of third parties with whom the business shares personal information.

A consumer shall have the right to request that a business that sells the consumer’s personal information, or that discloses it for a business purpose, disclose to that consumer:
The categories of personal information that the business collected about the consumer.

The categories of personal information that the business disclosed about the consumer for a business purpose.
The Right to equal service and price, even if you exercise your privacy rights
A consumer shall have the right to request that a business delete any personal information about the consumer which the business has collected from the consumer.

A business that receives a verifiable request from a consumer to delete the consumer’s personal information pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section shall delete the consumer’s personal information from its records and direct any service providers to delete the consumer’s personal information from their records.

A business or a service provider shall not be required to comply with a consumer’s request to delete the consumer’s personal information if it is necessary for the business or service provider to maintain the consumer’s personal information in order to:

Complete the transaction for which the personal information was collected, provide a good or service requested by the consumer, or reasonably anticipated within the context of a business’s ongoing business relationship with the consumer, or otherwise perform a contract between the business and the consumer.
Detect security incidents, protect against malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity; or prosecute those responsible for that activity.
Debug to identify and repair errors that impair existing intended functionality.
Exercise free speech, ensure the right of another consumer to exercise his or her right of free speech, or exercise another right provided for by law.
Comply with the California Electronic Communications Privacy Act pursuant to Chapter 3.6 (commencing with Section 1546) of Title 12 of Part 2 of the Penal Code.

Engage in public or peer-reviewed scientific, historical, or statistical research in the public interest that adheres to all other applicable ethics and privacy laws, when the businesses’ deletion of the information is likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of such research, if the consumer has provided informed consent.
Exercise free speech, ensure the right of another consumer to exercise his or her right of free speech, or exercise another right provided for by law.
To enable solely internal uses that are reasonably aligned with the expectations of the consumer based on the consumer’s relationship with the business.
Otherwise use the consumer’s personal information, internally, in a lawful manner that is compatible with the context in which the consumer provided the information.

(hereinafter: “the website”) uses cookies and other related technologies (for convenience all technologies are referred to as “cookies”). Cookies are also placed by third parties we have engaged. In the document below we inform you about the use of cookies on our website.

A cookie is a small simple file that is sent along with pages of this website and stored by your browser on the hard drive of your computer or another device. The information stored therein may be returned to our servers or to the servers of the relevant third parties during a subsequent visit.
A script is a piece of program code that is used to make our website function properly and interactively. This code is executed on our server or on your device.

A web beacon (or a pixel tag) is a small, invisible piece of text or image on a website that is used to monitor traffic on a website. In order to do this, various data about you is stored using web beacons.

We have made agreements about the use of cookies with other companies that place cookies. However, we cannot guarantee that these third parties handle your personal data in a reliable or secure manner. Parties such as Google are to be considered as independent data controllers. We recommend that you read the privacy statements of these companies.

Some cookies ensure that certain parts of the website work properly and that your user preferences remain known. By placing functional cookies, we make it easier for you to visit our website. This way, you do not need to repeatedly enter the same information when visiting our website and, for example, the items remain in your shopping cart until you have paid.
We use statistics cookies to optimize the website experience for our users. With these statistics cookies we get insights in the usage of our website.

Marketing/Tracking cookies are cookies or any other form of local storage, used to create user profiles to display advertising or to track the user on this website or across several websites for similar marketing purposes.

On our website, we have included content from Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook to promote web pages (e.g. “like”, “pin”) or share (e.g. “tweet”) on social networks like Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook. This content is embedded with code derived from Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook and places cookies. This content might store and process certain information for personalized advertising.

Please read the privacy statement of these social networks (which can change regularly) to read what they do with your (personal) data which they process using these cookies. The data that is retrieved is anonymized as much as possible. Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook are located in the United States.

all_text: Cookie Policy (UK) - KEMMLIT | Equipments For Sanitary Rooms
This Cookie Policy was last updated on 22 February 2024 and applies to citizens and legal permanent residents of the United Kingdom.

(hereinafter: “the website”) uses cookies and other related technologies (for convenience all technologies are referred to as “cookies”). Cookies are also placed by third parties we have engaged. In the document below we inform you about the use of cookies on our website.

A cookie is a small simple file that is sent along with pages of this website and stored by your browser on the hard drive of your computer or another device. The information stored therein may be returned to our servers or to the servers of the relevant third parties during a subsequent visit.
A script is a piece of program code that is used to make our website function properly and interactively. This code is executed on our server or on your device.

A web beacon (or a pixel tag) is a small, invisible piece of text or image on a website that is used to monitor traffic on a website. In order to do this, various data about you is stored using web beacons.

Some cookies ensure that certain parts of the website work properly and that your user preferences remain known. By placing functional cookies, we make it easier for you to visit our website. This way, you do not need to repeatedly enter the same information when visiting our website and, for example, the items remain in your shopping cart until you have paid. We may place these cookies without your consent.

We use statistics cookies to optimize the website experience for our users. With these statistics cookies we get insights in the usage of our website. We ask your permission to place statistics cookies.

Marketing/Tracking cookies are cookies or any other form of local storage, used to create user profiles to display advertising or to track the user on this website or across several websites for similar marketing purposes.

On our website, we have included content from Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook to promote web pages (e.g. “like”, “pin”) or share (e.g. “tweet”) on social networks like Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook. This content is embedded with code derived from Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook and places cookies. This content might store and process certain information for personalized advertising.
Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook are located in the United States.

You have the following rights with respect to your personal data:

Right to transfer your data: you have the right to request all your personal data from the controller and transfer it in its entirety to another controller.

scraped_data.meta_description: KEMMLIT benches are characterized by high quality, stability and durability. The classic checkroom bench systems with bench top and base frame can be used in
all_text: Benches - KEMMLIT | Equipments For Sanitary Rooms

KEMMLIT offer different kinds of bench systems from the standard one to the locker ingrated bench. All of our benches are made of compact grade laminate in order to make those suitable for dry and wet rooms as a perfect complement to our lockers.
KEMMLIT benches are characterized by high quality, stability and durability. The classic checkroom bench systems with bench top and base frame can be used in all dry and wet rooms

The bench top consists of HPL solid core panels with an additional overlay. Together with the bench consoles and coat rack supports made of anodized aluminum tubes, a stable and extremely durable bench is guaranteed. On request, the bench is also available with a safety coat hook rail made of round aluminum profiles. The triple safety hooks are also made of aluminum.

Benches are suitable as practical seating in changing areas. The combination with wardrobe lockers is therefore particularly convenient for the user and offers additional storage space under the benches. We also offer sector-specific solutions here: from pull-out benches and front-mounted benches to benches with shoe compartments.
Suitable for wet rooms thanks to waterproof materials
Maximum stability thanks to solid construction
The exclusive version made of 13 mm HPL solid core material with a black core.
Available as a seat cube or in a U-shape.
Seat bench cover in HPL (suitable for wet rooms) or with beech wood slats.
The length is manufactured to fit precisely according to customer specifications.
With safety hook strip type 1010 made of round aluminum profiles and corner panel.

all_text: Cookie Policy (EU) - KEMMLIT | Equipments For Sanitary Rooms
This Cookie Policy was last updated on 22 February 2024 and applies to citizens and legal permanent residents of the European Economic Area and Switzerland.

(hereinafter: “the website”) uses cookies and other related technologies (for convenience all technologies are referred to as “cookies”). Cookies are also placed by third parties we have engaged. In the document below we inform you about the use of cookies on our website.

A cookie is a small simple file that is sent along with pages of this website and stored by your browser on the hard drive of your computer or another device. The information stored therein may be returned to our servers or to the servers of the relevant third parties during a subsequent visit.
A script is a piece of program code that is used to make our website function properly and interactively. This code is executed on our server or on your device.

A web beacon (or a pixel tag) is a small, invisible piece of text or image on a website that is used to monitor traffic on a website. In order to do this, various data about you is stored using web beacons.

Some cookies ensure that certain parts of the website work properly and that your user preferences remain known. By placing functional cookies, we make it easier for you to visit our website. This way, you do not need to repeatedly enter the same information when visiting our website and, for example, the items remain in your shopping cart until you have paid. We may place these cookies without your consent.

We use statistics cookies to optimize the website experience for our users. With these statistics cookies we get insights in the usage of our website. We ask your permission to place statistics cookies.

Marketing/Tracking cookies are cookies or any other form of local storage, used to create user profiles to display advertising or to track the user on this website or across several websites for similar marketing purposes.

On our website, we have included content from Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook to promote web pages (e.g. “like”, “pin”) or share (e.g. “tweet”) on social networks like Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook. This content is embedded with code derived from Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook and places cookies. This content might store and process certain information for personalized advertising.

Please read the privacy statement of these social networks (which can change regularly) to read what they do with your (personal) data which they process using these cookies. The data that is retrieved is anonymized as much as possible. Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook are located in the United States.

You have loaded the Cookie Policy without javascript support. On AMP, you can use the manage consent button on the bottom of the page.

You can use your internet browser to automatically or manually delete cookies. You can also specify that certain cookies may not be placed. Another option is to change the settings of your internet browser so that you receive a message each time a cookie is placed. For more information about these options, please refer to the instructions in the Help section of your browser.

Please note that our website may not work properly if all cookies are disabled. If you do delete the cookies in your browser, they will be placed again after your consent when you visit our website again.
9. Your rights with respect to personal data
You have the following rights with respect to your personal data:
You have the right to know why your personal data is needed, what will happen to it, and how long it will be retained for.
Right of access: You have the right to access your personal data that is known to us.
Right to rectification: you have the right to supplement, correct, have deleted or blocked your personal data whenever you wish.
If you give us your consent to process your data, you have the right to revoke that consent and to have your personal data deleted.
Right to transfer your data: you have the right to request all your personal data from the controller and transfer it in its entirety to another controller.
Right to object: you may object to the processing of your data. We comply with this, unless there are justified grounds for processing.

To exercise these rights, please contact us. Please refer to the contact details at the bottom of this Cookie Policy. If you have a complaint about how we handle your data, we would like to hear from you, but you also have the right to submit a complaint to the supervisory authority (the Data Protection Authority).

KEMMLIT ist der europäische Marktführer für Sanitärtrennwandsysteme. KEMMLIT steht für hohe Qualität „made in Germany“ und ist europäischer Marktführer im Bereich der Sanitärtrennwandsysteme. Durch unser Fachwissen bieten wir individuelle Lösungen und unterstützen unsere Kunden bei der Planung von Sanitärräumen, von der Planung über technische Zeichnungen bis hin zur maßgeschneiderten Produktion.

Seit vielen Jahrzehnten liefern wir unseren Kunden herausragende individuelle Lösungen für Trennwandsysteme in öffentlichen Toilettenbereichen. In den letzten Jahren wurden unsere Produkte mit zahlreichen Preisen und Auszeichnungen geehrt! Mit unserer breiten Auswahl findet jeder Kunde das passende System, das perfekt auf sein Projekt und Budget angepasst wird.
Von der Entwicklung über die Fertigung und Montage bis hin zur Betreuung vor und nach der Objektrealisierung – der Kunde steht immer im Mittelpunkt.
Unser innovatives und anpassungsfähiges Produktsortiment erfüllt die höchsten Ansprüche.

scraped_data.meta_description: KEMMLIT shelves and shelving systems are available in either 13 mm thick SGL or 10 mm thick toughened safety glass. The shelves made of SGL have a thickness
all_text: Full Product Range - KEMMLIT | Equipments For Sanitary Rooms

KEMMLIT product range also includes different bespoke options such as: shelves and racks, hairdryer stations, urinal screens, as well as sanitary accessories. The ranges offer ideal solutions for all types of projects and installations. Designed to perfectly complement KEMMLIT cubicle systems.
Feel free to contact us for further information.
KEMMLIT shelves and shelving systems are available in either 13 mm thick SGL or 10 mm thick toughened safety glass. The shelves made of SGL have a thickness of 13 mm.

SGL is particularly water-resistant, scratch-resistant, rot-proof, antibacterial and chemical-resistant. Glass shelves are extremely stable, scratch-resistant and easy to clean. It can be satin-finished, textured or colored enameled. The polished edges are visually attractive and protect against injuries.
Colors, dimensions and designs can be customized according to your requirements.
Modesty screens and urinal screens are increasingly incorporated in the planning of sanitary and bathroom facilities. Aside from hygiene, privacy is very important in these areas.

The material and colour can be perfectly attuned to the layout of the room and the stalls. In addition to the standard sizes, urinal screens with special dimensions, with or without supporting pedestal, can also be realised.
VERSATILE, STABLE, SUITABLE FOR WET ROOMS
Custom-made hairdryer stations in combination with mirrors offer a variety of design options depending on the room situation and requirements.

Hairdryer stations made of SGL solid core material are extremely robust and ideally suited to the rigors of everyday use in fitness, sports and swimming pool areas. They offer plenty of space for concealed cable routing.
Designs, dimensions and colors can be customized.
In addition to our standardized products, we are also happy to manufacture custom-made furniture according to your requirements.

Through the combination of traditional craftsmanship and state-of-the-art machinery, we realize your wishes in high-quality furniture construction with the highest precision. From individual shelves, racks and cupboards to complex furnishing solutions made entirely from SGL. This ensures a uniform appearance within the entire interior design

In this privacy statement, we explain what we do with the data we obtain about you via
. We recommend you carefully read this statement. In our processing we comply with the requirements of privacy legislation. That means, among other things, that:
we clearly state the purposes for which we process personal data. We do this by means of this privacy statement;
we aim to limit our collection of personal data to only the personal data required for legitimate purposes;
we first request your explicit consent to process your personal data in cases requiring your consent;

we respect your right to access your personal data or have it corrected or deleted, at your request.

Our website does not respond to and does not support the Do Not Track (DNT) header request field.
Our website uses cookies. For more information about cookies, please refer to our Cookie Policy on our
We have concluded a data Processing Agreement with Google.
Google may not use the data for any other Google services.
The inclusion of full IP addresses is blocked by us.

We are committed to the security of personal data. We take appropriate security measures to limit abuse of and unauthorized access to personal data. This ensures that only the necessary persons have access to your data, that access to the data is protected, and that our security measures are regularly reviewed.

This privacy statement does not apply to third party websites connected by links on our website. We cannot guarantee that these third parties handle your personal data in a reliable or secure manner. We recommend you read the privacy statements of these websites prior to making use of these websites.

We reserve the right to make amendments to this privacy statement. It is recommended that you consult this privacy statement regularly in order to be aware of any changes. In addition, we will actively inform you wherever possible.

If you have any questions or want to know which personal data we have about you, please contact us. Please make sure to always clearly state who you are, so that we can be certain that we do not modify or delete any data of the wrong person. We shall provide the requested information only upon receipt of a verifiable consumer request. You can contact us by using the information below.
9.1 You have the following rights with respect to your personal data
You may submit a request for access to the data we process about you.
You may request an overview, in a commonly used format, of the data we process about you.

You may request correction or deletion of the data if it is incorrect or not or no longer relevant. Where appropriate, the amended information shall be transmitted to third parties having access to the information in question.
You have the right to withdraw consent at any time, subject to legal or contractual restrictions and reasonable notice. You will be informed of the implications of such withdrawal.
You have the right to address a challenge concerning non-compliance with PIPEDA to our organization and, if the issue is not resolved, to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada.

We shall give access to personal information in an alternative format to an individual with a sensory disability who has a right of access to personal information under PIPEDA and who requests that it be transmitted in the alternative format if (a) a version of the information already exists in that format; or (b) its conversion into that format is reasonable and necessary in order for the individual to be able to exercise rights.

Our website is not designed to attract children and it is not our intent to collect personal data from children under the age of consent in their country of residence. We therefore request that children under the age of consent do not submit any personal data to us.

This privacy statement was last updated on 22 February 2024 and applies to citizens and legal permanent residents of the United Kingdom.
In this privacy statement, we explain what we do with the data we obtain about you via
. We recommend you carefully read this statement. In our processing we comply with the requirements of privacy legislation. That means, among other things, that:
we clearly state the purposes for which we process personal data. We do this by means of this privacy statement;
we aim to limit our collection of personal data to only the personal data required for legitimate purposes;
we first request your explicit consent to process your personal data in cases requiring your consent;
we take appropriate security measures to protect your personal data and also require this from parties that process personal data on our behalf;
we respect your right to access your personal data or have it corrected or deleted, at your request.
If you have any questions, or want to know exactly what data we keep of you, please contact us.

Our website uses cookies. For more information about cookies, please refer to our

We disclose personal information if we are required by law or by a court order, in response to a law enforcement agency, to the extent permitted under other provisions of law, to provide information, or for an investigation on a matter related to public safety.

If our website or organisation is taken over, sold, or involved in a merger or acquisition, your details may be disclosed to our advisers and any prospective purchasers and will be passed on to the new owners.
We have concluded a data processing agreement with Google.
Google may not use the data for any other Google services.
The inclusion of full IP addresses is blocked by us.

We are committed to the security of personal data. We take appropriate security measures to limit abuse of and unauthorised access to personal data. This ensures that only the necessary persons have access to your data, that access to the data is protected, and that our security measures are regularly reviewed.

This privacy statement does not apply to third-party websites connected by links on our website. We cannot guarantee that these third parties handle your personal data in a reliable or secure manner. We recommend you read the privacy statements of these websites prior to making use of these websites.

We reserve the right to make amendments to this privacy statement. It is recommended that you consult this privacy statement regularly in order to be aware of any changes. In addition, we will actively inform you wherever possible.
If you have any questions or want to know which personal data we have about you, please contact us. You can contact us by using the information below. You have the following rights:
You have the right to know why your personal data is needed, what will happen to it, and how long it will be retained for.
Right of access: You have the right to access your personal data that is known to us.
Right to rectification: you have the right to supplement, correct, have deleted or blocked your personal data whenever you wish.
If you give us your consent to process your data, you have the right to revoke that consent and to have your personal data deleted.
Right to transfer your data: you have the right to request all your personal data from the controller and transfer it in its entirety to another controller.
Right to object: you may object to the processing of your data. We comply with this, unless there are justified grounds for processing.
Please make sure to always clearly state who you are, so that we can be certain that we do not modify or delete any data of the wrong person.
If you are not satisfied with the way in which we handle (a complaint about) the processing of your personal data, you have the right to submit a complaint to the Information Commissioner’s Office:

Our website is not designed to attract children and it is not our intent to collect personal data from children under the age of consent in their country of residence. We therefore request that children under the age of consent do not submit any personal data to us.

scraped_data.title: Company - KEMMLIT | Equipments For Sanitary Rooms
scraped_data.meta_description: At KEMMLIT, customer satisfaction reigns as our paramount corporate objective. We consider ourselves integral partners to architects, planners, and craftsmen,
all_text: Company - KEMMLIT | Equipments For Sanitary Rooms

At KEMMLIT, customer satisfaction reigns as our paramount corporate objective. We consider ourselves integral partners to architects, planners, and craftsmen, ensuring that the customer remains at the forefront of every stage – from development and production to assembly and ongoing support.

Our unwavering dedication to delivering premium-grade products has propelled us to become the market leader. Whether it’s the product itself, its handling, or the support services provided, our customers reap the benefits of our exceptional performance. For over five decades, we’ve continually strived to provide our customers with superior and more innovative solutions.

Modern product engineering, rigorous quality assessments, and the exclusive use of top-tier materials guarantee reliable solutions that consistently meet the most stringent requirements. Our objective is to offer our customers nothing short of the best available solution. Personalized consultation services delivered by highly trained specialists and tailor-made solutions crafted by skilled engineers are as pivotal as our extensive product range, which caters to all our customers’ diverse needs.

As industry leaders, we assure our customers of our expertise in project planning and execution, regardless of scale, garnered through decades of experience, adherence to delivery schedules, and dependable installations. Excellence in every aspect – that’s our promise!

In 1885, the Kemmler family laid the foundation for what would become the Kemmler group of companies, with a vision encompassing various business sectors, including comprehensive solutions for sanitary rooms. Even before the outbreak of World War II in 1939, numerous projects in this domain were successfully realized.

However, the pivotal moment came after the Currency Reform of 1948, marking the formal establishment of the KEMMLIT department. By 1967, this thriving department evolved into a subsidiary company of the Kemmler group: KEMMLIT Bauelemente GmbH. This entity offered a holistic approach, providing consultation, planning, production, and installation services all under one roof.

In 1972, due to the burgeoning enterprise, the facilities at the Kemmler company in Tübingen outgrew their capacity. The ideal solution was found in Dusslingen, nestled in the picturesque Steinlach valley, a region adjacent to the Swabian Albs and located south of the renowned university city of Tübingen.
Today, still under the ownership of the Kemmler family, the company stands as one of Europe’s premier suppliers of equipments for sanitary rooms, holding the position of market leader in Germany.

Consistent quality control is another fundamental service component at KEMMLIT. We regularly carry out extensive function and wear tests in our laboratory. Each of our products undergoes a thorough final inspection.

Nothing is left to chance when it comes to installation. Intensively-trained specialists install the products to ensure quality and precision. In case you require our services, our fitters are there for you with their know-how.
After inspecting the installed product, you’ll be sure that you can count on KEMMLIT on a continuing basis.
WE ALWAYS GIVE 100% - even when it comes to protecting the climate!
Sustainability stands as a cornerstone within KEMMLIT’s corporate strategy, driving our commitment to effecting positive change for both our planet and our community in all our endeavors.

Our dedication to sustainability permeates every facet of our business operations. From the supply chain to the entirety of our production process and eventual disposal, we steadfastly uphold environmentally conscious practices and measures.
We are dedicated to the following core principles:
We collaborate closely with our suppliers to uphold high sustainability standards, favoring local partners and advocating for fair working conditions.

We continuously optimize our resource usage, including procuring 100% green electricity and generating our own power through one of the region’s largest photovoltaic systems, peaking at 800 kW. Through recycling and reuse initiatives, we actively reduce waste, while our products are primarily transported using our specially developed reusable racks.

Our manufacturing processes prioritize sustainability, employing eco-friendly practices and materials. Utilizing state-of-the-art machinery and operating a CO2-neutral wood chip heating system from our wood residues, we minimize our ecological footprint. As a DIN ISO 14001-certified company, we undergo regular external assessments to maintain our environmental standards.
our “Greenline products” are crafted solely from regional and sustainable raw materials, meeting the stringent criteria of the

designated by the Ministry of Economic Affairs, we actively participate in the climate protection and energy efficiency initiatives of the German industry. We strive to lead as pioneers and innovators in climate protection, using our platform to contribute positively to the future of our planet.
We take pride in our contributions toward a better world and extend a warm invitation for you to join us on this journey of making a meaningful difference together.

Our designs captivate with immediate impact and stand the test of closer scrutiny. Through close collaboration between our engineers and renowned architects, we continuously innovate in the development of new products.

The NOXX ‘floating’ toilet partition system is a testament to this collaboration, crafted in partnership with architects Wolfram Wöhr and Jörg Mieslinger. Emphasizing consistency in design from overarching vision to intricate details, NOXX has earned acclaim, including the prestigious iF product design award, for its distinctive and innovative design.
Company award Brand of the century 2022
Plus X Award for the partition wall system cell 2021
Red dot design award 2016 for cubicle system NOXX
German design award 2014 for cubicle system NiUU
PLUS X Award 2012 for cubicle system NiUU
Price for architecture and building 2012 for cubicle system NiUU
IF product design award 2012 for cubicle system NiUU
Red dot design award 2011 for cubicle system NiUU
Red dot design award 2011 for ethno
